page.title: 03LOCAL NEWS - MAY 1985
page.content: { { {The Playhouse Cinema - }A great loss was the Playhouse Cinema, designed by Major Cattenach of Kingussie and opened by Mr. J. McEwen MP in June 1937. Demolition commenced in May 1985. It was one of the best equipped cinemas on the east coast, holding up to 1021 people. In 1937 admission prices were 1/6 for the balcony, rising to 65p when it closed. Four managers spanned the 48 years of it's existence: Mr A Davidson, Mr Rodgers, Mr Hooper and finally Mr Smith. The cinema closed in 1974. The cinema was only used once after that - to play host for the last picture show, held by the Rotary Club of Dunbar on 24/11/ 84. 'Never Say Never Again' was chosen to be the last picture.
